wikitext.*:
'''Poisoned weapons''' were used by different races throughout the history of [[Middle-earth]].

==Orcs==
[[Orcs]] frequently used poisoned blades<ref>{{Cite DTP|LR 2.06.026}}</ref> and arrows. [[Huor]] of [[Dor-lómin]] was slain by a poisoned Orc-arrow that hit him in the eye.<ref>{{Cite DTP|S QS.20.026}}</ref> [[Andróg]] was wounded by poisoned Orc-arrow, but healed by [[Beleg]].<ref>{{CH|8}}</ref> Later [[Isildur]] was killed by several poisoned Orc-arrows that pierced his throat and his heart.<ref>{{UT|Gladden}}</ref> [[Celebrían]], wife of [[Elrond]], received a poisoned wound from the [[Orcs of the Misty Mountains]] and, although Elrond healed her body, she lost all joy in Middle-earth and departed over the sea.<ref>{{App|Eriador}}, entry about Chieftain Arahad I, p. 1043</ref>

==Elves==
It is said that [[Eldar]] never used any poison against their enemies.<ref>{{WJ|Maeglin}}</ref> However, there are some examples of [[Elves]] who used poisoned weapons. [[Eöl]] the Dark Elf had a poisoned javelin, which he threw at [[Maeglin]], but hit [[Aredhel]], who died from that wound shortly after.<ref>{{Cite DTP|S QS.16.035}}</ref> [[Elves of Nargothrond]] also used poisoned darts to protect their kingdom after the departure of [[Finrod]] and before the coming of [[Túrin]].<ref>{{Cite DTP|S QS.19.039}}</ref>

==Dwarves==
The chieftain of the [[Petty-dwarves]],<ref name="foundnargo">{{NM|P3vii}}, p. 305</ref> [[Mîm]], possessed a secret "long knife" that had "runes of venom" on it.<ref>{{CP|185}}</ref>

==Men==
[[Drúedain]] were famous for their use of poisoned arrows<ref>{{Cite DTP|LR 5.05.009}}</ref> and darts,<ref>{{UT|12b}}</ref> although they used poisoned weapons only when fighting against the Orcs<ref>{{UT|12c}}, Note 9</ref>.
